title: JSON schema for OpenFin application configuration files

appAssets.description: Set this object to co-deploy native apps along with your app.

alias.description: Name of the asset. The name will be used in launchExternalProcess to launch the asset.

args.description: The default command line arguments for the aforementioned target.

src.description: URL to a zip file containing the package files (executables, dlls, etc…).

target.description: Specifies default executable to launch. This option can be overridden in launchExternalProcess.

version.description: Version of the package. To force new updates, increment the version.

assets_url.description: If an application specifies a valid “assetsUrl”, then that “assetsUrl” will be used as the base portion of the URL instead of the OpenFin default, https://developer.openfin.co/release/.

devtools_port.description: You can access the Chromium development tools by navigating to the selected port, i.e.: http://localhost:9090.

dialogSettings.description: An optional object to customize the appearance of the RVM progress dialog.

bgColor.description: Determines the color of the dialog. Color value is a decimal representation of a 32 bit number (A,R,G,B). For instance : FF00FF00 or 4278255360 is fully opaque green.

logo.description: Determines the logo or image in the progress dialog. The logo should be a semi-transparent PNG. 100×25 pixels.

progressBarBgColor.description: Determines the background color of the area where the progress bar is displayed.

progressBarBorderColor.description: Determines the border color of the progress bar.

progressBarFillColor.description: Determines the color of the progress bar.

textColor.description: Determines the color of the text displayed above the progress bar location.

licenseKey.description: A string used as a licensing identifier for each customer/contract (RVM 2.7+). The OpenFin team will generate this for your production app.

runtime.description: Determines which runtime version the app will use.

arguments.description: Command line arguments to set when launching the runtime. The OpenFin Runtime supports Chromium command line switches e.g.: “– –disable-accelerated-compositing – –enable-threaded-compositing” for a complete list of values please refer to current Chromium switches.

fallbackVersion.description: The RVM will fallback to this version if it fails to retrieve the desired Runtime version, assuming this version is already installed. (RVM 2.8+)

forceLatest.description: If true, forces the runtime to always get the latest runtime version before launching (prevents background installs).

version.description: Specifies what version of the runtime the app should use. The value can either be a specific version or a release channel (e.g. alpha).

shortcut.description: Settings for the app’s desktop shortcut

company.description: Company name for the application shortcut.

description.description: A short description of the application shortcut. Will be shown when hovering over the shortcut icon.

force.description: If set to true, a desktop icon is always created on application start-up (even when user has deleted it). If set to false, a desktop icon is created on initial application launch but not created on subsequent application launches.

icon.description: Location for the icon image to be used when installing the application shortcut.

name.description: Name of the application to display with the shortcut.

startMenuRootFolder.description: Set this value with a folder path (e.g. foo/bar) and the RVM will create the start menu shortcut under RootFolder/Company/App.

target.description: Locations for where the application shortcut is added on the desktop owner’s machine. Available options are “desktop”, “start-menu” and “automatic-start-up”. The default is start-menu and desktop.

uninstall-shortcut.description: Removes the Start menu uninstall shortcut.

splashScreenImage.description: You can specify an image to display while the runtime is loading. It takes any image file (including semi-transparent PNGs).

accelerator.description: The name of this builder instance, which can be specified in the only/except property of a provisioner.

devtools.description: If true, allows the Dev Tools to be opened with the keyboard shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+i.

reload.description: If true, allows a window to reload with the keyboard shortcuts: Ctrl+r or F5.

reloadIgnoreCache.description: If true, allows a window to reload while ignoring the cache with the keyboard shortcuts: Ctrl+Shift or Shift+F5.

zoom.description: If true, enables the Zoom keyboard shortcuts: Ctrl+ (Zoom in), Ctrl- (Zoom out) and Ctrl+0 (Restore to 100%).

alwaysOnTop.description: A flag to always position the window at the top of the window stack.

applicationIcon.description: A URL for the icon to be shown in the window title bar.

autoShow.description: A flag to automatically show the Window when it is created.

childWindowAutoAuth.description: Allow non API created child windows, such as window.open, to authenticate.

clearChildSubscriptionsOnReload.description: Clear InterApplication subscriptions of all child windows when main window is reloaded.

contextMenu.description: A flag to show the context menu when right-clicking on a window. Gives access to the Developer Console for the Window.

cornerRounding.description: This defines and applies rounded corners for the window.

height.description: This defines and applies rounded corners for the window.

width.description: This defines and applies rounded corners for the window.

defaultCentered.description: Specifies that the window will be positioned in the center of the primary monitor when loaded for the first time on a machine. When the window corresponding to that id is loaded again, the position from before the window was closed is used.

defaultHeight.description: The default height of the window. Specifies the height of the window when loaded for the first time on a machine. When the window corresponding to that id is loaded again, the height is taken to be the last height of the window before it was closed.

defaultLeft.description: The default left position of the window. Specifies the position of the left of the window when loaded for the first time on a machine. When the window corresponding to that id is loaded again, the value of left is taken to be the last value before the window was closed.

defaultTop.description: The default top position of the window. Specifies the position of the top of the window when loaded for the first time on a machine. When the window corresponding to that id is loaded again, the value of top is taken to be the last value before the window was closed.

defaultWidth.description: The default width of the window. Specifies the width of the window when loaded for the first time on a machine. When the window corresponding to that id is loaded again, the width is taken to be the last width of the window before it was closed.

description.description: The name for the window which must be unique within the context of the invoking Application.

frame.description: A flag to show the frame.

icon.description: A URL for the icon to be shown in the window title bar.

maxHeight.description: The maximum height of a window. Will default to the OS defined value if set to -1.

maximizable.description: A flag that lets the window be maximized.

maxWidth.description: The maximum width of a window. Will default to the OS defined value if set to -1.

minHeight.description: The minimum height of a window.

minWidth.description: The minimum width of a window.

name.description: The name for the window which must be unique within the context of the invoking Application.

nonPersistent.description: A flag to configure the application as a non persistent. Runtime exits if there are no persistent apps running.

opacity.description: A flag that specifies how transparent the window will be. This value is clamped between 0.0 and 1.0.

resizable.description: A flag to drop to allow the user to resize the window.

resizeRegion.description: Define the attributes of the window's resize region.

bottomRightCorner.description: Defines a region in pixels of an additional square at the bottom right corner of a frameless window.

size.description: Defines a region in pixels that will respond to user mouse interaction for resizing a frameless window.

saveWindowState.description: A flag to cache the location of the window or not.

showTaskbarIcon.description: A flag to show the Window’s icon in the taskbar.

state.description: A string that sets the window to be “minimized”, “maximized”, or “normal” on creation.

taskbarIcon.description: The URL of an icon to be shown on the desktop. Support formats: Portable Network Graphic (PNG); Size: 256 x 256.

taskbarIconGroup.description: Group your OpenFin apps in the Taskbar. v5.0+

uuid.description: The UUID of the application, unique within the set of all other Applications running in OpenFin Runtime.

waitForPageLoad.description: When set to false, the page will render before the “load” event is fired on the window. Caution, when false you will see an initial empty white window.

supportInformation.description: An optional object to customize error messages.

company.description: Displays the company name in the title bar for the support error dialog that appears when an application fails to load.

email.description: Displays the email to contact in the support error dialog that appears when an application fails to load.

enableErrorReporting.description: To disable the error reporting feature, set this value to false.

forwardErrorReports.description: When set to true, prompts end users with a dialog when a deployment error occurs from within the RVM and enables them send along log files from their machine. Error reports are delivered to your email address set in supportInformation.

product.description: Displays the product name or application name in the support error dialog that appears when an application fails to load.
